dublin_core.dcvalue: Teens and young adults in the United States are in need of sexual and reproductive health information as evidenced by elevated rates of sexually transmitted infections STIs pregnancy and births among this population In person sexuality education programs are helpful but they are unlikely to rapidly accommodate teens and young adults in a moment of crisis Evidence suggests that technologies such as instant messaging IM and text messaging may be effective ways to provide teens and young adults with sexual and reproductive health information In September 2010 Planned Parenthood Federation of America launched a text and IM program designed to provide immediate answers to urgent sexual and reproductive health questions from a reliable and confidential source and to link young people to sexual and reproductive health services if needed
Using chat and text technologies to answer sexual and reproductive health questions: Planned Parenthood pilot study.
